intro: Gnaphalium andinum, commonly known as the Andean feather grass, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, fluffy flower heads. The plant is typically found in alpine and grassland environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers produce a light, feathery appearance. Gnaphalium andinum is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
